Who will inherit Ratan Tata's legacy in the Tata Group?Ratan Tata, a towering icon of industry and philanthropy who died on Wednesday, leaves behind a significant legacy and an empty chair.

TCS Q2 results: Dividend set at Rs 10 per share. Check key datesTCS Q2 results: The company reported a 5% year-on-year (YoY) rise in net profit, amounting to Rs 11,909 crore, compared to Rs 11,342 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year.

Ratan Tata was a great human being, very humble: Narayana MurthyIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy paid tribute to late industrialist, Ratan Tata. Murthy lauded Ratan Tata as a 'compassionate human being who transcended financial status and official power.'

Ratan Tata's successor at Tata Trusts: Who are the frontrunners?The trusts, particularly the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and Sir Ratan Tata Trust, collectively hold 66% of Tata Sons, making them the company's primary shareholders.

Star Health confirms data breach, clears CISO of wrongdoing amid claimsStar Health Insurance released a statement acknowledging the cyberattack. The company confirmed that it was a victim of a targeted malicious cyberattack, which led to unauthorised access to certain data.

When Ratan Tata cancelled London trip for his pet: Niranjan Hiranandani recountsRatan Tata death: Businessman Niranjan Hiranandani, who had invested in his friend Ratan Tata-backed Goodfellows, a companionship startup for senior citizens in 2022, recalled the veteran industrialist's down-to-earth nature.

Ratan Tata: The titan who built a billion-dollar empire without chasing billionaire statusRatan Tata's legacy endures as a titan who built a billion-dollar empire while never appearing on any billionaire lists.
Condolences pour in as India's business world bids farewell to Ratan TataThe former Tata Chairman had been undergoing treatment for a prolonged illness at Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Hezbollah leader escapes assassination as Israeli strikes kill 22 in BeirutSenior Hezbollah official Wafiq Safa narrowly escaped an assassination attempt during Israeli airstrikes on central Beirut, which resulted in the deaths of 22 people and wounded dozens more.

Goddess Kali's crown, gifted by PM Modi, stolen from Bangladesh templeThe silver, gold-plated crown was gifted to the goddess Kali at the Jeshoreshwari Temple in Satkhira by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi in 2021 during his visit.
Maharashtra Cabinet pushes to raise non-creamy layer income limit ahead of pollsThe move by the ruling BJP-Shiv Sena-NCP coalition in Maharashtra comes ahead of the Assembly polls.

When PM brought Nano plant to Gujarat after 1 word SMS to Ratan Tata in 2008Then Gujarat Chief Minister Narendra Modi had sent a one word SMS to the then Tata Group Chairman Ratan Tata after the Nano project was withdrawn from West Bengal in 2008.

Can a pretty office desk help you work better?Millennials and Gen Zers are sprucing up their work desks with all things beautiful, even if it comes with spending significant money. And it turns out, the move is not solely driven by the motive of acing the social media game.

Man killed after Audi rams his bike in Pune, driver detainedThe accident occurred in Pune when the Audi first hit three people riding an Activa, causing them to fall and sustain minor injuries. Shortly after, the luxury car rammed a biker who later succumbed to his injuries.

India's food plate is greenest in the world, says international study The report underscores that if more countries were to adopt India's dietary habits, it would lead to a notable reduction in environmental damage and help mitigate the impacts of climate change by the year 2050.

Elon Musk unveils Tesla's new two-door robotaxi with no steering or pedalsTesla CEO Elon Musk unveiled a long-awaited robotaxi with two gull-wing doors and no steering wheel or pedals at an event on Thursday, setting the stage for what he believes will fuel the electric vehicle maker's long-term growth.

Adopted from Goa, named after it: Ratan Tata's dog who sat beside his casketRatan Tata's loyal dog, Goa, paid his final respects beside the industrialist's Tricolour-draped casket, capturing the emotion of a bond.

Elderly couple dies by suicide in Rajasthan, alleging harassment by childrenAn elderly couple allegedly died by suicide in Rajasthan, leaving a note accusing their sons and daughters-in-law of harassment over property disputes.

Emmanuel Macron remembers Ratan Tata: France lost a dear friend from IndiaFrench President Emmanuel Macron praised Ratan Tata's contributions to innovation and manufacturing, as well as his role in strengthening India-France ties, along with his lasting legacy of philanthropy and humility.

Akhilesh Yadav visits barricaded JP Narayan Centre in Lucknow, jabs BJPSamajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav accused the BJP of setting up tin sheets before the main gate of Lucknow's JP Narayan Centre to apparently prevent entry to him to mark the birth anniversary of the socialist leader.
In pics: Houses damaged, cars mangled as Hurricane Milton devastates FloridaHurricane Milton has claimed 10 lives so far while the authorities have managed to rescue 4,300 people.

Ratan Tata cremated with state honours, hundreds gather to say goodbyeRatan Tata funeral: The Maharashtra government on Thursday declared a day of mourning as a mark of respect for Ratan Tata. The legendary business leader and chairman emeritus of Tata Sons died on Wednesday at the age of 86.

Rajinikanth's daughter Soundarya on Vettaiyan: One and only Thalaivar foreverDirector Soundarya Rajinikanth watched her father Rajinikanth's Vettaiyan and shared her thoughts about the film. She complimented director TJ Gnanavel and composer Anirudh Ravichander and called the film a blockbuster.

28-year-old PhD student dies by suicide at IIT Kanpur, 4th such case in a yearA top police official said they found the student's room locked when they reached the hostel, adding that her body was recovered after breaking open the door of the room.

Vettaiyan box office Day 1: Rajinikanth's film takes 2nd biggest opening in 2024Director TJ Gnanavel's Vettaiyan recorded a phenomenal opening at the box office on its first day in theatres. The film, starring Rajinikanth and Amitabh Bachchan, released in theatres on October 10.

When Narayana Murthy learnt lesson in compassionate capitalism from Ratan TataNarayana Murthy recalled an incident when he invited Ratan Tata to inaugurate an event in Karnataka's Hubli and how the former Tata Group chief's gestures taught him lessons in compassionate capitalism.

Iran warns Gulf nations against helping Israel, says 'will respond accordingly'The Gulf Arab nations have urged the US to prevent Israel from targeting Iran's oil facilities, fearing that Tehran may retaliate by striking their own oil infrastructure in the region.

Cocaine worth Rs 2,000 crore, hidden in namkeen packets, seized in DelhiDelhi Police Special Cell busted a drug trafficking network, seizing 200 kg of cocaine worth Rs 2,000 crore from a Ramesh Nagar warehouse, linked to a previous seizure of 600 kg of drugs.
Untainted by scandal, untouched by hate: That's Ratan TataRatan Naval Tata did not succumb to the acrimonious politics often associated with public figures pawing for power and pelf.

One dead, 12 trapped 1,000 feet underground at Colorado mine tourist attractionThe incident occurred following an elevator failure at the tourist site. Emergency responders are working to fix the elevator and rescue efforts are underway.
How genetic carrier screening can help with family planningGenetic disorders are a healthcare challenge in India, making carrier screening an essential tool for couples planning a family.

Ajith's new pics from Good Bad Ugly out, makers reconfirm Pongal 2025 releaseThe makers of Ajith Kumar's Good Bad Ugly shared new pictures of the actor from the Madrid shooting spot. They reconfirmed the film's release on Pongal 2025.

KBC 16: Amitabh Bachchan, Aamir Khan discuss giving acting guidance to their sonsActor Aamir Khan and son Junaid Khan will grace Kaun Banega Crorepati 16 as contestants. The two will be present to surprise host Amitabh Bachchan on his 82nd birthday.

Actor Manasi Parekh: With National Award, people will now focus on Gujarati industryActor Manasi Parekh received the Best Actress National award for her performance in the film, Kutch Express. In an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, she spoke about how three wins for Kutch Express will help shift the focus on Gujarati film industry and how, as a producer, she plans to take Gujarati films on a global stage. She also spoke about her television days and how it left her with burnout.

Elon Musk reveals Tesla Cybercab at We, Robot event, driverless and no steering wheel in the carDuring the We, Robot event, Tesla CEO Elon Musk unveiled a prototype of a fully autonomous car, called the Cybercab.

Samsung issues apology for lagging innovation, vows to regain competitive edgeSamsung Electronics has openly acknowledged its recent shortcomings in an official letter following the release of its Q3 2024 earnings guidance.

Mozilla Firefox users beware, your device is at high risk and here is how you can fix it  The Indian Computer Emergency Response Team has alerted Mozilla users about serious vulnerabilities that threaten device security. The government has asked these users to immediately update their software to mitigate risks posed by these flaws.

sports.headline: D Gukesh clear favourites in World Championship final vs Ding Liren: NakamuraIndia's 18-year-old Grand Master D Gukesh is clear favourite in the World Championship final against Ding Liren, says Hikaru Nakamura. Gukesh has been in sensational form of late and recently guided India to their maiden Chess Olympiad victory.

Lionel Messi's return spoiled as Venezuela hold Argentina, Brazil edge past ChileLionel Messi's return to the Argentina team was spoiled by Venezuela, who held the World Champions to a 1-1 draw on October 10, Thursday. Brazil secured a last-gasp win to edge past Chile.

Tom Latham's plan for New Zealand against India: No fear, take it to themNewly-appointed New Zealand captain Tom Latham wants his side to be fearless and take the game to India during the upcoming Test series, which begins on October 16. The India series will be Latham's first assignment as full-time Test captain.

We gave our soul for George Baldock in England win: Greece's Vangelis PavlidisGreece's hero against England, Vangelis Pavlidis, claimed that the entire team gave their soul for George Baldock in their historic win at Wembley on October 10, Thursday. Pavlidis scored a brace as Greece defeated England 2-1.

King of Clay: Why Rafael Nadal's French Open dominance might never be matchedRafael Nadal won 22 Grand Slam titles in his decorated career. 14 of them came at the Roland Garros - a love affair that symbolises one of the most dominant sporting achievements by an athlete. Beating Nadal on the red dirt of Paris was nearly impossible.

Joe Root reveals how previous Pakistan tour helped him bat in Multan's heatStar England batter Joe Root has revealed how the previous experience of batting in Pakistan came in handy during his record-breaking partnership with Harry Brook in the first Test in Multan.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
